Bogdan Planić pred transferom karijere! Hteo je u Zvezdu, htela i ona njega, ali nije bilo izvodljivo?
Bekali ponudio povišicu, ali...
04 Nov 2019 by Aleksandar Gligorić
Bogdan Planić je jedna od najvrelijih tema u rumunskoj sportskoj javnosti ovih dana.
Prema saznanjima tamošnjih medija, srpski štoper koji je član FSCB-a (nekadašanja Steaua), nalazi se na korak od transfera u Fenerbahče, iako se nadao i opciji povratka u Crvenu zvezdu.
Planić je leta 2017. došao u tadašnju Steauu iz Vojvodine u transferu teškom 300.000 evra i potpisao je ugovor na tri godine. Postao je stub odbrane, zvanično najbolji štoper lige, a potom je izabran i za najboljeg stranog fudbalera rumunskog šampionata . U jednom periodu je bio i kapiten kluba iz Bukurešta i postao jedan od najvrednijih igrača u rumunskom fudbalu. Čak se spekulisalo da je na pragu milionskog transfera u Ajntraht iz Frankfurta, ali ga je kontroverzni gazda kluba Điđi Bekali zadržao uz zahtev da zainteresovani klub mora da plati otkupnu klauzulu od 10.000.000 evra.
Kako niko nije hteo da plati toliki novac, Planić je ostao i imao uspone i padove. Kontroverzni Bekali, koji je poznat po čudnom ponašanju prema igračima, je u jednom trenutku pretio da će ga izbaciti iz tima zbog slabih rezultata celog tima, ali Planić je ipak ostao stub odbrane.
Sada mu Bekali nudi novi ugovor?!
Zato što je Planić ušao u poslednju godinu aktuelnog ugovora. Od 1. januara, na šest meseci pre isteka, će moći bez dozvole FSCB-a da potpiše predugovor sa bilo kojim zainteresovanim klubom i da ode na leto bez obeštećenja. Bekali je svetsan da u toj priči gubi veliki novac i zato nudi srpskom štoperu produžetak saradnje.„Ponudio sam mu povišicu sa 12.000 evra mesečno na 15.000 mesečno. Sa porezima, njegova plata me košta 25.000 evra mesečno jer je stranac“, rekao je Bekali.
Inače, najplaćeniji igrač u klubu je Denis Man sa 186.000 evra mesečno, slede Pincili, Njoere, Koman, Tanase, Momčilović, Hora i Salomao sa po 180.000 evra godišnje neto. U tu grupu bi ušao i Planić kada bi prihvatio novi ugovor, ali prema szananjima rumunskih medija, to se neće desiti.
Srbinu je izgleda dosta Bekalija i lude atmosfere u klubu. Da bi prihvatio novi ugovor, očekivao bi i bonus za potpis koji Bekali ne želi da ponudi iako će potom morati da kupuje štopera koji bi zamenio Planića i sigurno će ga više koštati?!
Kako pišu rumunski mediji, Planić se već poverio prijateljima u svlačionici da ima ponudu Fenerbahčea i da je ona najbolja od svih koje je dobio. Najverovatnije će je prihvatiti, mada je navodno njegova želja bila da se vrati u Crvenu zvezdu za koju je igrao u sezoni 2014/15. Pogotovo što je sada Crvena zvezda mnogo napredovala u odnosu na period kada je Planić igrao na Marakani i velika mu je želja da sa crveno-belima igra u Evropi. Rumuni pišu da je interes bio obostran, ali da se nije daleko odmaklo jer Zvezda nije prodala mladog štopera kojeg je planirala za prodaju (najverovatnije Babić op.a.) i zato se nije daleko odmaklo u razgovorima oko povratka Planića.
U ovom trenutku, Planić je najbliži prelasku u Fenerbahče, a izgleda da je samo pitanje samo momenta za realizaciju transfera. Da li će Bekali da prihvati simbolično obeštećenje u januaru i pustiti ga u Tursku ili će mu zagorčati život do kraja sezone, skoniti ga iz tima i onda ga izgubiti bez obeštećenja na leto?
Kako god, Planić je taj koji drži sve karte u rukama, pa se Điđi Bekali ne pita mnogo oko konačnog raspleta.

Bogdan Planic before career transfer! He wanted in the Star, she wanted him too, but it wasn't feasible?
Becalli offered a raise, but ...
04 Nov 2019 by Aleksandar Gligoric
Bogdan Planic is one of the hottest topics in the Romanian sports public these days.
According to local media reports, the Serbian stopper, who is a member of the FSCB (formerly Steau), is one step away from transferring to Fenerbahce, although he also hoped to return to Red Star.
Planic came to the then Steau of Vojvodina in summer 2017 in a transfer worth 300,000 euros and signed a three-year contract. He became the pillar of defense, officially the best stopper of the league, and then was selected as the best foreign player of the Romanian Championship. At one point he was captain of the Bucharest club and became one of the most valuable players in Romanian football. It has even been speculated that he is on the verge of a million-dollar transfer to Eintracht from Frankfurt, but the controversial boss of the club, Jiji Beqali, has withheld him demanding that the interested club have to pay a € 10,000,000 buyout clause.
As no one wanted to pay that much money, Planic stayed and had his ups and downs. The controversial Beckali, who is known for his strange behavior towards the players, at one point threatened to throw him out of the team due to poor performance of the entire team, but Planic remained the pillar of defense.
Now Bekali is offering him a new contract ?!
Because Planic entered the last year of the current contract. From January 1, six months before expiration, it will be able to sign a pre-contract with any interested club without the permission of the FSCB and go on a flight without compensation. Beckali is aware that he is losing big money in this story and that is why he offers the Serbian stopper an extension of his cooperation. "I offered him a raise from 12,000 euros a month to 15,000 a month. With taxes, his salary costs me € 25,000 a month because he is a foreigner, ”Beckali said.
By the way, the highest paid player in the club is Dennis Man with € 186,000 a month, followed by Pincili, Njoere, Koman, Tanase, Momcilovic, Hora and Salomao with € 180,000 a year each. Planic would also join the group if he accepts the new contract, but according to Romanian media, that will not happen.
Serbs seem to have a lot of Beckali and a crazy atmosphere in the club. In order to accept the new contract, he would expect a signing bonus that Becalli does not want to offer, although he will then have to buy a stop to replace Planic and it will certainly cost him more ?!
According to Romanian media, Planic has already confided to his locker room friends that he has a Fenerbahce bid and that she is the best of all he has received. He will most likely accept her, though reportedly his desire was to return to the Red Star for which he played in the 2014/15 season. Especially now that the Red Star has made a lot of progress over the period when Planic played in Marakana and has a great desire to play with the red and whites in Europe. The Romanians say that the interest was mutual, but that it did not go far because Zvezda did not sell the young stopper he planned to sell (most likely Babić op.a.) and therefore did not move far in discussions about Planic's return.
At the moment, Planic is closest to moving to Fenerbahce, and it looks like it is only a matter of time for a transfer. Will Beckali accept the symbolic compensation in January and release him to Turkey, or will he endanger his life for the rest of the season, remove him from the team and then lose him without compensation for the summer?
However, Planic is the one who holds all the cards in his hands, so Djidji Bekali doesn't wonder much about the final deal.
